name: Latin OCR
body:
### Latin OCR
This project aims to develop high-quality OCR processes and results for digitized Latin books. For the first phase of the project, we're OCR'ing [21,509 books identified as potentially containing Latin content in the Internet Archive](http://www.cs.cmu.edu/~dbamman/latin.html), using [Tesseract](https://github.com/tesseract-ocr/tesseract) 3.04.00 with the v0.3.0 [Latin](https://ryanfb.github.io/latinocr/) and v2.0 [Ancient Greek](https://ancientgreekocr.org/) language training files. For an overview of the project, see [this poster PDF](https://www.dropbox.com/s/zeqr8bsm586kvsw/Research%20Computing%202016%20Poster.pdf?dl=0).

This project is run by [Ryan Baumann](http://ryanfb.github.io/) of the [Duke Collaboratory for Classics Computing](http://dcthree.github.io/).
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
